page.title: 13PEBMARSH PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {St.John the Baptist's}was probably begun at the end of the 13th century.It was first a little church with a thatched roof,small windows and a little door.Then it was enlarged.The walls are flint rubble.The porch is made of wood and{Tudor} brick.Inside,there is a Nave,a North Aisle,a South Aisle,a Chancel and a Sanctuary.The Tower has four floors and six bells.The church is famous for the{brass of Sir William Fitzralph,} made in 1323.In the registers,the first recorded persons to get married were{Richarde Blakeling}and{Anne {Alston}on 1st.January 1654.The new gate was made in 1977,by{Mr.Pearson}of Pebmarsh,to commemorate the Queen's{ {Silver Jubilee.}At least two{Communion {Services}a month are held.The{ {Rector,the Rev.S.Hough,}is also the Rector of Alphamstone and Lamarsh.
